| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | [EvilHack - monst.c, line 1049](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/master/src/monst.c#L1049) |

A **rodent of unusual size**, r, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears as part of the [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") patch incorporated in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). The rodent of unusual size is a [medium](/wiki/Medium "Medium")-sized [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that is among the stronger [rodents](/wiki/Rodent "Rodent") in the [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"), and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). Like other [rats](/wiki/Rat "Rat"), Convicts can pacify or tame them by [chatting](/wiki/Chatting "Chatting") to one.

A rodent of unusual size has a single bite attack.

## Generation

Randomly generated rodents of unusual size are always created hostile, and may appear in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). An [enormous rat](/wiki/Enormous_rat_\(UnNetHack\) "Enormous rat (UnNetHack)") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a rodent of unusual size.

Rodents of unusual size appear among the random r that are part of the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Healer quest](/wiki/Healer_quest "Healer quest"). They also appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for Convicts and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Convict quest](/wiki/Convict_quest "Convict quest").

In Hack'EM, rodents of unusual size appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for [Yeomen](/wiki/Yeomen "Yeomen") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Yeoman quest](/wiki/Yeoman_quest "Yeoman quest").

## Encyclopedia entry

Rodents of unusual size? I don't think they exist.  
\[ The Princess Bride, directed by Rob Reiner,  
written by William Goldman ]

html:
Rodent of unusual size (EvilHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
r rodent of unusual size
Difficulty 9
Attacks Bite 2d6
r rodent of unusual size
Difficulty 9
Attacks

Bite 2d6

Base level 8
Base experience 70
Speed 8
Base AC 2
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 600
Nutritional value 250
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A rodent of unusual size:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • normally appears in small groups.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 1049

A rodent of unusual size, r, is a type of monster that appears as part of the Convict patch incorporated in EvilHack and Hack'EM. The rodent of unusual size is a medium-sized carnivorous animal that is among the stronger rodents in the monster class, and can be seen via infravision. Like other rats, Convicts can pacify or tame them by chatting to one.

A rodent of unusual size has a single bite attack.

Generation

Randomly generated rodents of unusual size are always created hostile, and may appear in small groups. An enormous rat can grow up into a rodent of unusual size.

Rodents of unusual size appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for Healers and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Healer quest. They also appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for Convicts and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Convict quest.

In Hack'EM, rodents of unusual size appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for Yeomen and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Yeoman quest.

Encyclopedia entry

Rodents of unusual size? I don't think they exist.
[ The Princess Bride, directed by Rob Reiner,
written by William Goldman ]

A '''rodent of unusual size''', {{monsym|rodent of unusual size}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears as part of the [[Convict]] patch incorporated in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. The rodent of unusual size is a [[medium]]-sized [[carnivorous]] [[animal]] that is among the stronger [[rodent]]s in the [[monster class]], and can be seen via [[infravision]]. Like other [[rat]]s, Convicts can pacify or tame them by [[chatting]] to one.

A rodent of unusual size has a single bite attack.

==Generation==
Randomly generated rodents of unusual size are always created hostile, and may appear in small [[group]]s. An [[Enormous rat (UnNetHack)|enormous rat]] can [[grow up]] into a rodent of unusual size.

Rodents of unusual size appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first [[quest]] [[monster class]] for [[Healer]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Healer quest]]. They also appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first quest monster class for Convicts and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Convict quest]]. 

In Hack'EM, rodents of unusual size appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first quest monster class for [[Yeomen]] and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Yeoman quest]].
